title: Kim Basinger to play Christian Grey's ex-lover in Fifty Shades Darker
title_page: Kim Basinger to play Christian Grey's ex-lover in Fifty Shades Darker | Daily Mail Online
text:
She's played some risque characters in such massive hits as L.A. Confidential.
And it seems like Kim Basinger isn't done with steamy roles just yet, as it was announced that she will be the newest main character in the racy Fifty Shades film franchise.
Variety claimed on Thursday that the 62-year-old actress will play the role of Elena Lincoln in the upcoming sequel Fifty Shades Darker.
Scroll down for video
Not shy: it seems like Kim Basinger isn't done with steamy roles just yet, as it was announced that she will be the newest main character in the racy Fifty Shades film franchise
Elena is protagonist Christian Grey's business partner, and a former lover of the bondage-savvy industry mogul. She also happens to be quite a few years older than the 27-year-old businessman.
The first film was rumored to have soured the cast and crew on the franchise, as author E.L. James apparently had numerous acrimonious disagreements with director Sam Taylor-Johnson that threatened to derail the production.
And at one point in February of last year lead Jamie Dornan, 33, was rumoured to have threatened to leave the franchise altogether.
Cooler heads prevailed: At one point in February of last year lead Jamie Dornan, 33, even threatened to leave the franchise altogether
Things appear to be back on track however, as a new director has been brought on to film the remaining two sequels.
Hollywood vet James Foley, who is known for Glengarry Glen Ross and directing numerous episodes of Netflix hit House of Cards, agreed to take over helming duties.
In addition, both Dornan and co-star Dakota Johnson, 26, have announced they will in fact both participate in the sequels.
Original cast: Both Dornan and co-star Dakota Johnson, 26, have announced they will in fact both participate in the sequels
The studio, Universal, is planning on filming the final two parts of the series, Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed, back to back.
Though it does focus on the provocative world of S&M, Fifty Shades of Grey holds the record for the largest ever weekend opening in February.
Sequel Fifty Shades Darker is scheduled for a February 10th, 2017 release.
